author: cnbc.com
title: MuleSoft reports 4Q loss
text:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) _ MuleSoft Inc. (MULE) on Thursday reported a loss of $25.1 million in its fourth quarter.
On a per-share basis, the San Francisco-based company said it had a loss of 19 cents. Losses, adjusted for stock option expense, came to 12   matched Wall   six   also for a loss of 12 cents per share.
The software developer posted revenue of $88.7 million in the period, exceeding Street forecasts. Four analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $83.1 million.
  a loss of $80 million, or 75 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $296.5 million.
For the current quarter ending in April, MuleSoft expects its results to range from a loss of 9 cents per share to a loss of 7 cents per share.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $87 million to $90 million for the fiscal first quarter.
MuleSoft expects full-year results to range from a loss of 30 cents per share to a loss of 26 cents per share, with revenue ranging from $405 million to $415 million.
MuleSoft shares have increased 12
